label: Policy LCD_39240
description: Policy rules for LCD_39240

label: diagnosis_radiculopathy_lum...
description: Diagnosis of lumbar radiculopathy as a covered indication for ESI

label: diagnosis_radiculopathy_lum...
description: Diagnosis of lumbar radiculopathy as a covered indication for ESI

label: pain_scale_baseline = TRUE
description: Documentation of objective pain scale used at baseline prior to interventions for assessment of response

label: functional_assessment_basel...
description: Documentation of objective functional assessment used at baseline prior to interventions for assessment of response

label: pain_scale_followup = TRUE
description: Documentation of objective pain scale used at each follow-up for assessment of response

label: functional_assessment_follo...
description: Documentation of objective functional assessment used at each follow-up for assessment of response

label: repeat_esi_pain_relief_min_...
description: Minimum percentage of sustained pain relief required for repeat ESI (at least 50%)

label: repeat_esi_improvement_dura...
description: Minimum duration in months for sustained improvement to qualify for repeat ESI (at least 3 months)

label: esi_assess_clinical_respons...
description: Time period in days after an ESI to assess the clinical response (up to 14 days)

label: pain_duration_weeks >= 4
description: Minimum duration of pain in weeks required for ESI eligibility (at least 4 weeks)

label: acute_herpes_zoster_refract...
description: Indicates if acute herpes zoster is refractory to conservative management, potentially bypassing the 4-week wait requirement

label: conservative_care_failure =...
description: Indicates if the patient has failed to respond to at least four weeks of noninvasive conservative care

label: esi_conjunction_conservativ...
description: Indicates if Epidural Steroid Injections should be performed in conjunction with conservative treatments

label: patient_rehabilitation_prog...
description: Indicates if the patient should be part of an active rehabilitation program, home exercise program, or functional restoration program

label: esi_treatment_duration_max_...
description: Maximum duration in months for ESI treatment to be considered medically reasonable and necessary without further review (12 months)

label: esi_continuation_beyond_12m...
description: Indicates if frequent continuation of ESIs beyond 12 months may trigger a focused medical review

label: esi_continuation_beyond_12m...
description: Criterion for ESI continuation beyond 12 months: pain is severe enough to cause a significant degree of functional disability

label: esi_continuation_beyond_12m...
description: Minimum percentage of sustained pain relief required for ESI continuation beyond 12 months (50%)

label: esi_continuation_beyond_12m...
description: Requires documentation of rationale for ESI continuation beyond 12 months

label: esi_continuation_beyond_12m...
description: Requires notification of the primary care provider regarding ESI continuation beyond 12 months

label: esi_continuation_beyond_12m...
description: Requires ESI use beyond one year to be combined with multimodal therapy

label: image_guidance_ct = TRUE
description: Indicates if CT image guidance is used for ESI procedures

label: contrast_agent_used = TRUE
description: Indicates if a contrast agent is generally used during image-guided ESI procedures (unless contraindications exist)

label: allergy_contrast_media = TRUE
description: Indicates a documented allergy to low molecular weight nonionic contrast, which may affect image guidance options

label: image_guidance_ultrasound =...
description: Indicates if ultrasound guidance may be used for ESI procedures under specific conditions (e.g., contraindication to contrast, pregnancy)

label: contrast_agent_used = FALSE
description: Indicates if a contrast agent is generally used during image-guided ESI procedures (unless contraindications exist)

label: image_guidance_required = TRUE
description: Indicates if image guidance is generally required for ESI procedures

label: allergy_contrast_media = TRUE
description: Indicates a documented allergy to low molecular weight nonionic contrast, which may affect image guidance options

label: image_guidance_ultrasound =...
description: Indicates if ultrasound guidance may be used for ESI procedures under specific conditions (e.g., contraindication to contrast, pregnancy)

label: esi_biologicals_not_covered...
description: Indicates that ESIs performed with biologicals are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

label: esi_unapproved_substances_n...
description: Indicates that ESIs performed with other substances not FDA designated for this use are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

label: esi_for_nonspecific_lbp_not...
description: Field: esi_for_nonspecific_lbp_not_covered

label: esi_for_axial_spine_pain_no...
description: Indicates that ESIs for axial spine pain are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

label: esi_for_complex_regional_pa...
description: Indicates that ESIs for complex regional pain syndrome are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

label: esi_for_widespread_diffuse_...
description: Indicates that ESIs for widespread diffuse pain are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

label: esi_for_neuropathy_other_ca...
description: Indicates that ESIs for pain from neuropathy from other causes are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

label: esi_for_cervicogenic_headac...
description: Indicates that ESIs for cervicogenic headaches are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

label: cesi_ilesi_bilateral_not_co...
description: Indicates that performing Caudal Epidural Steroid Injections (CESIs) or Interlaminar Epidural Steroid Injections (ILESIs) bilaterally is not considered medically reasonable and necessary

label: contraindication_spinal_inf...
description: Contraindication for ESI: suspected or active localized spinal infection

label: contraindication_systemic_i...
description: Contraindication for ESI: significant systemic infection

label: contraindication_spinal_cor...
description: Contraindication for ESI: compressive lesions of the spinal cord

label: contraindication_conus_medu...
description: Contraindication for ESI: compressive lesions of the conus medullaris

label: contraindication_cauda_equi...
description: Contraindication for ESI: compressive lesions of the cauda equina

label: contraindication_cancer_ris...
description: Contraindication for ESI: suspicion or major risk factors for cancer

label: contraindication_infectious...
description: Absolute contraindication for ESI: infectious spondylitis (ACR guidance)

label: contraindication_myelopathy...
description: Absolute contraindication for ESI: myelopathy (ACR guidance)

label: contraindication_inability_...
description: Absolute contraindication for ESI: inability to obtain informed consent (ACR guidance)

label: contraindication_skin_punct...
description: Absolute contraindication for ESI: infection at the skin puncture site (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_u...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: uncorrected anticoagulation therapy (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_h...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: hypersensitivity to administered agents (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_h...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: hepatitis (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_u...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: uncontrolled diabetes mellitus (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_c...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: congestive heart failure (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_i...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: immunosuppressed state (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_p...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: patient improving on medical and physical therapy (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_s...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: severe spinal canal stenosis (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_n...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: no response to a previous well-performed ESI (ACR guidance)

label: relative_contraindication_s...
description: Relative contraindication for ESI: complication to steroid therapy (e.g., Cushingâ€™s) (ACR guidance)

label: contraindication_osteoporos...
description: Contraindication for high-risk individuals with prior history of osteoporosis or osteopenia when considering ESI with corticosteroids (WIP Benelux Workgroup recommendation)

label: esi_for_radicular_lbp_short...
description: Field: esi_for_radicular_lbp_short_term_benefit_window_weeks

label: hpa_axis_systemic_effects_d...
description: Duration in weeks the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis systemic effects may last after an ESI (3 weeks or longer)

label: tfesi_spinal_levels_max <= 2
description: Maximum number of spinal nerve root levels allowed for Transforaminal Epidural Steroid Injections (TFESIs) in one spinal region during a single session (2 levels)

label: tfesi_spinal_region_count_m...
description: Maximum number of spinal regions allowed for Transforaminal Epidural Steroid Injections (TFESIs) in a single session (1 region)

label: cesi_spinal_levels_max <= 1
description: Maximum number of spinal levels allowed for Caudal Epidural Steroid Injections (CESIs) in a single session (1 level)

label: ilesi_spinal_levels_max <= 1
description: Maximum number of spinal levels allowed for Interlaminar Epidural Steroid Injections (ILESIs) in a single session (1 level)

label: tfesi_bilateral = TRUE
description: Indicates if Transforaminal Epidural Steroid Injections (TFESIs) can be performed bilaterally when clinically indicated

label: repeat_esi_initial_failure_...
description: Minimum number of days after initial ESI failure before a repeat ESI can be performed (14 days)

label: initial_esi_contrast_requir...
description: Indicates if an initial injection of contrast is required to confirm epidural placement, unless contraindication exists

label: subsequent_esi_corticostero...
description: Indicates if subsequent epidural steroid injections should include corticosteroids

label: subsequent_esi_anesthetic_c...
description: Indicates if subsequent epidural steroid injections may be combined with anesthetics

label: multiple_blocks_same_sessio...
description: Indicates that performing multiple blocks (e.g., sympathetic, facet, trigger point injections) during the same session as ESIs is generally not covered

label: facet_synovial_cyst_esi_sam...
description: Indicates that an ESI and a facet synovial cyst procedure performed in the same session is an allowed exception to the multiple blocks rule

label: sedation_moderate_not_cover...
description: Indicates that moderate sedation is generally not considered medically reasonable and necessary for ESI procedures

label: sedation_deep_not_covered =...
description: Indicates that deep sedation is generally not considered medically reasonable and necessary for ESI procedures

label: anesthesia_general_not_cove...
description: Indicates that general anesthesia is generally not considered medically reasonable and necessary for ESI procedures

label: mac_anesthesia_not_covered ...
description: Indicates that Monitored Anesthesia Care (MAC) is generally not considered medically reasonable and necessary for ESI procedures

label: oral_anxiolytics_sufficient...
description: Indicates that oral anxiolytics are typically sufficient for patients with needle phobia or anxiety during ESI procedures

label: esi_sessions_max_per_region...
description: Maximum number of ESI sessions allowed per spinal region in a rolling 12-month period (4 sessions, as per policy limitations)

label: esi_multiple_spinal_regions...
description: Indicates that injecting more than one spinal region in the same session is not considered medically reasonable and necessary

label: predetermined_esi_series_no...
description: Indicates that prescribing a predetermined series of ESIs is not considered medically reasonable and necessary

label: steroid_dose_triamcinolone_...
description: Maximum recommended dose of Triamcinolone per ESI session in milligrams (80mg)

label: steroid_dose_betamethasone_...
description: Maximum recommended dose of Betamethasone per ESI session in milligrams (12mg)

label: steroid_dose_dexamethasone_...
description: Maximum recommended dose of Dexamethasone per ESI session in milligrams (15mg)

label: steroid_dose_methylpredniso...
description: Maximum recommended dose of Methylprednisolone per ESI session in milligrams (40mg, recommendation from WIP Benelux Workgroup)

label: cervical_ilesi_max_level = ...
description: Anatomical limitation for cervical interlaminar ESIs: should not be performed above C7 (NASS guidance)

label: non_particulate_steroid_use...
description: Recommendation from NASS to use non-particulate steroids for cervical and thoracic spine ESIs

label: tfesi_sessions_max_same_set...
description: Maximum number of Transforaminal ESI procedures that can be performed at a single setting (e.g., single level bilaterally or two levels) according to NASS guidance (2)

label: cesi_ilesi_sessions_max_sam...
description: Maximum number of Caudal ESI or Interlaminar ESI procedures that can be performed at a single setting according to NASS guidance (1)

label: cesi_ilesi_not_in_conjuncti...
description: Indicates that CESIs or ILESIs should not be performed in conjunction with a TFESI injection according to NASS guidance

label: successful_esi_injections_c...
description: Maximum number of ESI injections most patients respond to for a specific episode of back and radicular pain (3)

label: esi_beyond_3_injections_cri...
description: Non-evidence-based criteria from NASS for medically appropriate performance of more than 3 injections (e.g., SSNBs for surgical planning, new injuries, inaccurate prior injections, exacerbation, high-risk surgical candidates)

label: steroid_type_triamcinolone_...
description: Indicates if Triamcinolone is not recommended for ESI use due to FDA label change

label: steroid_type_particulate_no...
description: Recommendation to avoid particulate steroids for cervical TFESIs due to safety concerns

label: steroid_type_non_particulat...
description: Recommendation to use non-particulate steroids for cervical TFESIs

label: steroid_type_non_particulat...
description: Recommendation to use non-particulate steroids for lumbar TFESIs (equivocal efficacy but improved safety profile)
